Legal_Issue: Did the poor quality of interpretation during the refugee hearing breach the Applicant's right to procedural fairness?
Governing_Law: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Outcome: The application for judicial review is dismissed
Procedural_Context: Judicial review analyzed whether interpretation errors impacted the Board's decision on the Applicant's credibility and claim
Credibility_Assessment: The interpreter's errors did not materially affect the Applicant's credibility
Legal_Provision: s. 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Interpretation errors did not impact key findings such as credibility or ability to escape detention
Application_Error: Wrong terminology, omissions, embellishments, commentary by interpreter
Review_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness found
Legal_Standard: Continuous, precise, competent, impartial, and contemporaneous interpretation required under s. 14
Authority: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, s. 14
Decision_Review_Issue: Quality of interpretation affecting procedural fairness
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: s. 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Cause_of_Refusal: Poor interpretation did not result in unfairness sufficient to overturn decision
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Evidentiary_Issues: Errors in interpretation including omissions and embellishments
Procedural_Fairness: Right to fair hearing with proper interpretation
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's credibility was assessed and not materially affected by interpretation errors
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that poor interpretation breached procedural rights
Relevant_Law: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, s. 14
